title: Why Riot? (Hunt of the Blood Moon)
body: So who's bright idea was it to heavily restrict the champion pool for a mode and *not* make the only 20 playable champions automatically free to play in that mode?

replies.body: But Riot have already said that all the champions in the pool will be free this weekend while the game mode is live?

Some feedback for the game mode.
The ending seems a bit off. I think it's would be much better if
- When the enemy are defeated, there should be a drum sound (like the instrument of the Blood Moon theme) to make it sounds more rewarding.
- The enemies' corpses should remain on the field.

well I must admit I'm a little disappointed that their aren't many assassins on the rotation, but I think the 20 champions that can be played are more or less the most fun champions to play in this style of gamemode, and the experience itself is quite enjoyable with alot of differences from regular summoners rift and alot of different viable playstyles (except the kennen who wanted to adc and stayed botlane waiting for 'minions' to spawn).
Are they really even assassins. Id bet they don't have yi in there (officially classed as an assassin) but do have lee (an overpowered bruiser which rito refuses to nerf as it would hurt their pride)
I'm more confused of the exclusion of riven, when diana, yasuo, and ekko are included.
yi would suck ass in that game mode,
i do wish rito would allow more champs to be played in it there are assassins who are missing from it and champs who aren't assassins in it, and it doesn't even have all the blood moon champs
